item.title: Cloudflare 公布销售前景后股价升至创纪录水平
item.description: Cloudflare 公司经过重组，增加了更多的大型企业客户，公布了好于预期的销售数据，超过了季度和年度预期，股价飙升至创纪录水平。【原文：Cloudflare Inc. shares surged to a record after posting better-than-expected sales figures that topped quarterly and annual estimates, following a reorganization and the addition of more large enterprise customers.】

item.title: 亚马逊和苹果业绩强劲，S&P 500 指数跃升，重燃涨势
item.description: 周五，美国股市上涨，原因是亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc.【原文：US stocks gained on Friday as blowout earnings results from Amazon.com Inc. and a strong holiday forecast from Apple Inc. rekindled risk appetite.】

item.title: 随着改革的到来，英国央行成员开始更好地解释自己
item.description: 在下周的投票中，英格兰银行的九位决策者将首次阐述其利率决策背后的思路，以努力提高央行的透明度。【原文：At next week’s vote the Bank of England’s nine policymakers will for the first time set out the thinking behind their interest-rate decisions, in efforts to improve transparency at the central bank.】

item.title: 罗根与施密德一道以通胀为由反对美联储降息
item.description: 两位美联储官员表示，他们不支持美国央行本周降息的决定，理由是通胀率仍然过高。【原文：Two Federal Reserve officials said they did not support the US central bank’s decision to cut interest rates this week, citing inflation that remains too high.】

item.title: 阿达尼旗舰公司旨在筹集 30 亿美元资金用于资本支出
item.description: 阿达尼企业有限公司（Adani Enterprises Ltd.）正计划通过供股筹集多达 2,500 亿卢比（合 28 亿美元）的资金，熟悉内情的人士称，该公司正寻求投资资本密集型企业，如其机场企业。【原文：Adani Enterprises Ltd. is planning to raise as much as 250 billion rupees ($2.8 billion) through a rights issue, people familiar with the matter said, as it seeks to invest in capital intensive businesses like its airports venture.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称欧洲央行对利率的立场良好但不固定
item.description: 欧洲央行管理委员会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，欧洲央行的货币政策定位良好，但随着官员们努力应对包括来自金融市场的风险，货币政策仍有可能发生转变。【原文：The European Central Bank’s monetary policy is well positioned but could yet shift as officials grapple with risks including those emanating from financial markets, Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.】

item.title: 受贸易战影响，加拿大经济增长乏力
item.description: 加拿大经济似乎有望在 7 月至 9 月间实现增长，有可能从第二季度的萎缩中反弹，但仍受到美国关税的削弱。【原文：The Canadian economy appears to be on track to eke out growth between July and September, likely bouncing back from a second-quarter contraction but remaining weakened by US tariffs.】

item.title: 美联储施密德在反对降息时提到通胀风险
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫-施密德（Jeff Schmid）表示，他对美国央行本周的降息决定投了反对票，因为他担心经济增长和投资会给通胀带来上升压力。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City President Jeff Schmid said he voted against the US central bank’s decision to lower interest rates this week because he’s concerned that economic growth and investment will put upward pressure on inflation.】

item.title: 巴西信贷危机使企业借款计划泡汤
item.description: 巴西的信用危机推高了借贷成本，也吓坏了投资者，迫使这个拉丁美洲最大经济体的企业放弃或缩减利用债务市场的计划。【原文：Brazil’s credit flareups are driving up borrowing costs and spooking investors, forcing companies in Latin America’s largest economy to scrap or scale down their plans to tap the debt market.】

item.title: 巴克莱建议押注英国央行下周意外降息
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）表示，交易员们低估了英国央行下周降息的可能性，这是对决策者将继续按兵不动这一共识的最新警告。【原文：Traders are underestimating the chance of an interest rate cut by the Bank of England next week, says Barclays Plc, in the latest warning against the consensus that policy makers will keep borrowing costs on hold.】

item.title: 美国银行哈特内特认为黄金和中国股票是人工智能热潮的最佳避险工具
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）的策略师认为，人工智能贸易的蓬勃发展已将估值推高至较高水平，中国股票和黄金是最好的避险工具。【原文：Chinese stocks and gold are the best hedges against a boom in the artificial intelligence trade that has pushed valuations to elevated levels, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 挪威一家公司股价暴跌，分析师急于提升评级
item.description: 康斯伯格集团（Kongsberg Gruppen ASA）的股票在业绩公布后暴跌18%，分析师们对这家挪威国防技术公司的股票给予了全面的支持。【原文：Analysts covering Kongsberg Gruppen ASA have given a sweeping endorsement of the Norwegian defense technology firm’s shares after they fell 18% in a post-results plunge.】

item.title: Adobe 努力向投资者保证它能在人工智能时代蓬勃发展
item.description: 本周，Adobe 公司召集了 1 万名营销人员、电影制片人和内容创作者参加其年度会议，以说服他们相信公司的软件产品正在适应人工智能，并且仍然是他们工作的最佳工具。【原文：Adobe Inc. brought together 10,000 marketers, filmmakers and content creators to its annual conference this week to persuade them that the company’s software products are adapting to artificial intelligence and remain the best tools for their work.】

item.title: 沙特财富基金将更加专注于打造全球领军企业
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯 1 万亿美元的财富基金计划在未来几年更加关注人工智能公司 Humain 等投资组合公司，以期吸引投资者，并将一些子公司打造成全球冠军企业。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s $1 trillion wealth fund plans to sharpen its focus on portfolio companies like artificial intelligence firm Humain in coming years, with an eye on attracting investors and building some of its subsidiary firms into global champions.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"平衡从过剩到制裁的石油风险
item.description: 该生产商集团可能会在 12 月份小幅增加供应量。【原文：The producer group is likely to pursue anot modest supply increase for December.】

item.title: 私人信贷的 "不良 PIK "不断增加，表明违约问题严重
item.description: 它本应是信贷市场突发问题的快速解决方案。【原文：It was supposed to be a quick fix for a sudden problem in credit markets.】

item.title: 印度央行拒绝部分债券投标引发本月最大涨幅
item.description: 印度央行在每周的国债拍卖中拒绝了一些投标，这表明印度政府对交易商可能寻求的较高收益率感到不安，印度国债的涨幅为一个月来最大。【原文：Indian government bonds gained the most in a month after the central bank rejected some bids at its weekly debt auction, signaling discomfort with the higher yields likely sought by traders.】

item.title: 里夫斯希望堵住财政黑洞，为何英国预算案中增税迫在眉睫？
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）即将迎来一个艰难的秋季预算，经济学家们做出了一个共同的预测：增税在即。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is heading into a difficult autumn budget as economists make a common prediction: tax rises are in store.】

item.title: 特朗普达成和平协议后，柬埔寨和泰国将解除边境武装
item.description: 就在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普促成和平协议几天后，柬埔寨和泰国朝着缓和领土紧张局势迈出了重要一步，两国表示将开始从共同边界上撤除武器。【原文：Cambodia and Thailand took a major step toward de-escalating territorial tensions just days after a peace deal brokered by US President Donald Trump, saying they will start to remove weapons from their shared border.】

item.title: 雪佛龙首席财务官认为石油供应充足，低迷将持续到 2026 年
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.首席财务官 Eimear Bonner 表示，在欧佩克+成员国和不结盟国家产量强劲的情况下，油价低迷有可能持续到明年。【原文：Chevron Corp. Chief Financial Officer Eimear Bonner said there’s a risk the oil-price slump persists into next year amid robust output from OPEC+ members and non-aligned nations.】

item.title: 特朗普与习近平的会晤对 TikTok 协议并不重要
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，亚历山德拉-莱文（Alexandra Levine）将报道 TikTok 在美国生存的持续传奇。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Alexandra Levine reports on the continuing saga of TikTok’s survival in the US.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮推动美国国内生产总值增长
item.description: 投资人工智能的热潮及其引发的股市大涨正在推动美国经济增长。【原文：The rush to invest in AI and the stock-market surge it created are boosting US economic growth.】

item.title: 信贷市场的裂痕可能为华尔街敲响警钟
item.description:
需要多少只蟑螂才能击沉一艘船？我们可能很快就会知道。【原文：

How many cockroaches does it take to sink a ship? We may soon find out.

】

item.title: 芬兰以安全为由收紧 5G 网络对华为的禁令
item.description: 芬兰计划将高风险供应商排除在其第五代移动网络的更大范围之外，以配合欧盟加强整个集团电信安全的努力。【原文：Finland plans to exclude high-risk vendors from a bigger portion of its fifth-generation mobile network in line with a push by the European Union to boost telecommunications security across the bloc.】

item.title: 印度交易所股票大幅波动反映出对期权的担忧
item.description: 据报道，印度市场监管机构关于收紧股票衍生品规则的评论短暂地引发了期权市场参与者的困惑和焦虑，随后 BSE Ltd. 的股价周五出现波动。【原文：BSE Ltd.’s shares fluctuated on Friday after reported comments from India’s market regulator about the tightening rules for equity derivatives briefly triggered confusion and anxiety among options market participants.】

item.title: 今年万圣节，债务发行和估值吓坏了投资者
item.description:
我们询问了一些投资者目前最担心的问题。【原文：

We ask some investors what’s at the top of their list of worries right now. 

】

item.title: 债务增加，股票估值：这些图表困扰着华尔街
item.description: 受中美贸易紧张局势降温前景的提振，美国股市在历史高点附近徘徊，美国企业在很大程度上抵御了关税压力。但这并不意味着华尔街的专业人士会在这个万圣节安然入睡。【原文：US stocks are hovering near all-time highs, buoyed by the prospect of cooling trade tensions between the US and China as corporate America largely brushes off tariff pressures. But that doesn’t mean that Wall Street professionals will be sleeping easy this Halloween.】

item.title: 圭亚那新油田帮助提高产量，埃克森公司业绩超出预期
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司在圭亚那的第四个石油生产项目开始运营后，业绩连续第六个季度超出华尔街预期。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. outperformed Wall Street expectations for a sixth consecutive quarter after beginning operations at its fourth oil-production project in Guyana.】

item.title: 关税谈判升温，瑞士贸易外交官三赴美国
item.description: 自今年 8 月美国对瑞士征收超额关税以来，瑞士最高贸易外交官三次前往华盛顿，试图通过谈判降低关税税率。【原文：Switzerland’s top trade diplomat made three trips to Washington since outsized US tariffs came into effect in August as Bern attempts to negotiate a lower rate.】

item.title: 赫斯交易帮助提高石油产量，雪佛龙业绩超出预期
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.）的盈利超出预期，因为该公司首次将 530 亿美元收购赫斯公司（Hess Corp.【原文：Chevron Corp. beat earnings estimates as profits from the $53 billion Hess Corp. acquisition were included in the results for the first time, boosting oil production and cash flow.】
